author: garegin16
body: I know that Server releases have sconfig, but it seems that it’s a basic enough function that should have a CLI equivalent.

comments.author: RichardSiddaway
comments.body: This could get messy.  Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server 1709 use different CIM classes. Windows 10 uses one or the other CIM class depending on version. Pre Windows 10/Server 2016 you were required to use a COM object. The COM object and the Windows 1709 CIM class don't work if called remotely though the CIM class does work through a PowerShell direct session.
